info.game_comments:
Ron Trigueiro game 1.

Missing introduction and first 27 clues of the Jeopardy! Round.

(1, 4).clue: Antonym of conscious & unconscious, both starting with the letter "A"

(6, 4).clue: His widow, nee Marilyn Taylor, is the sister of this woman who directed the dancers on his show

(5, 5).clue: The sum total of years that Sleeping Beauty & Rip van Winkle slept

(6, 5).clue: Before exclamining "& aw-a-ayy we go!" Jackie would ask the bandleader for this

(1, 1).clue: The countries at war in Tolstoy's "War & Peace"

(2, 1).clue: A program at the 1987 Oshkosh airshow marked the 50th anniversary of this person's disappearance

(3, 1).clue: A secret document you're not allowed to look at, or ad section in the newspaper that you are

(4, 1).clue: It can precede squirrel whale, or wolf

(5, 1).clue: Film starring Robert De Niro which followed 3 young steelworkers through service in Vietnam

(6, 1).clue: Missouri's best-known nickname, it's the only one with a verb in it

(1, 2).clue: Emmy & Oscar winner whose autobiography is titled "Call Me Anna"

(2, 2).clue: Called "The Henry Ford of Aviation", he's famous for the 2-seat Cub

(3, 2).clue: 1981 hit for Kool & the Gang, or what they probably had after they found out it went to #1

(4, 2).clue: Colorful middle name of Elijah, Cher's son by rock singer Gregg Allman

(5, 2).clue: In this 1979 film, Robert Duvall said he loved the smell of napalm in the morning

(6, 2).clue: Sooner or later, you'll remember it's the Sooner State

(1, 3).clue: 1st novel by James Jones, it outsold all other works of fiction in 1951

(2, 3).clue: The landers of Vikings 1 & 2 are sitting on this planet

(3, 3).clue: From French "not warm", it's to be cool or casually unconerned

(5, 3).clue: Van Johnson was charged with mutiny after taking command of this ship in a typhoon

(6, 3).clue: 30,000 men willing to serve in Mexican War when 2800 were requested gave Tennessee this nickname

(1, 4).clue: The 1st book of Paul Mark Scott's "Raj Quartet"

(2, 4).clue: In 1861, Lincoln appointed Thaddeus Lowe to head an Army Corps set up to use these

(3, 4).clue: When you come to this Italian word on a musical score, you should play very loudly

(4, 4).clue: On the primary bow of a rainbow, this color always appears on the inside of the arch

(5, 4).clue: In the movie about German WWI aces, "The Blue Max" was not a plane but this

(6, 4).clue: Perhaps its center spot in the arch of the original 13 states got it dubbed the Keystone State

(1, 5).clue: In 1987, the British government banned papers from printing excerpts from this Peter Wright bestseller

(2, 5).clue: Year during which the 1st man went into outer space

(3, 5).clue: Johnny Carson's Carnac the Magnificent is also this, which means "all-knowing"

(4, 5).clue: In song, "She wore it for her lover who was far, far away"

(5, 5).clue: In 1950, this pair was "At War with the Army"

(6, 5).clue: All 5 counties in this "Ocean State" have direct water access to the Atlantic

(0, 0).clue: After a 9/25/87 coup, this South Pacific island severed its 113-year link with the British crown
